meanings.definition: A mythical creature resembling a large, hairy humanoid.
meanings.sent1: The children told stories about the yowie living in the forest.
meanings.sent2: I read a book about a yowie in the mountains.
meanings.sent3: The yowie in the story turned out to be a friendly giant.
meanings.sent4: The yowie in the legend was as mysterious as the shadows in the night.
meanings.sent5: The yowie's footprints were as big as dinner plates, leaving a trail in the mud.

meanings.sent1: Don't try to yowie me with your spooky stories!
meanings.sent2: The haunted house always manages to yowie visitors.
meanings.sent3: He tried to yowie his little sister by hiding behind the door.
meanings.sent4: The dark alley seemed to yowie even the bravest souls.
meanings.sent5: The sudden thunderstorm yowieed everyone at the campfire.

meanings.definition: A loud, wild cry or shout.
meanings.sent1: The yowie of the crowd could be heard from far away.
meanings.sent2: A yowie echoed through the valley, startling the birds.
meanings.sent3: The yowie of excitement erupted when the team won the game.
meanings.sent4: Her yowie of frustration filled the room, making everyone stop and listen.
meanings.sent5: The yowie of the wind in the trees sounded like a chorus of ghosts.
